intro: Trisetaria glacialis, commonly known as the glacier sedge, is a flowering plant native to cold, alpine regions. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that bloom in clusters. This species thrives in nutrient-poor, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous areas with high altitudes. Its ability to withstand harsh environmental conditions makes it an important component of alpine ecosystems. Trisetaria glacialis plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small invertebrates in its native range.
